title: How Britain votes
brief_description: The General Election of 1950 won by Atlee, is taken as an example to illustrate the functioning of the British electoral system. Footage of the election machinery is shown; the selection of candidate; the work of his local election agent; canvassing the electorate; policing; the work of the returning officer; Polling Day; announcement of the results; State opening of Parliament by George V.
